intro: Buddleja formosana, commonly known as the Formosan butterfly bush, is a deciduous shrub native to Taiwan. It features showy, fragrant, panicles of purple to pink flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves that are typically hairy and have a rough texture. It is well adapted to moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. Buddleja formosana is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
